author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> Yeah, agreed on stability
If we fix it to 32bytes, there would need to be a restriction in the EL client to not be able to produce blocks with less than 32. Cant even do a canonical padding really because the EL when processing will need to parse the extradata

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> We're *probably* passing M1 now. We have all the Geth vectors in our code and can send and parse all those messages. We're not running against Geth yet, I'm just working on that integration piece now.

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I'll update the sheet once we can build a chain with Geth

content: <dannyryan> üéâ

It updates engine_preparePayload to return an object instead of just a quantity value

author: bridge-bot
content:
<n0ble> thanks Matt! (re @lightclient: New release for the execution-apis: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.2
It updates engine_preparePayload to return an object instead of just a quantity value)

author: m.kalinin
content:
@here Interop spec is updated with the new version of the Engine API: 
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.2
The only substantial change in this release is the following:
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/77

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> IIRC, we were OK to have extra_data of a dynamic type during the related discussion in discord. What inconveniences/issues you think the dynamic type brings after all? (re @protolambda: FYI: currently the consensus specs define the extra_data field as a SSZ byte list with a limit of 32 bytes. This is kind of a bad hybrid between dynamic size like eth1, and 32 byte graffiti like in eth2. If you prepare an execution genesis config, and plan to start a consensus chain with merge at slot 0, then make sure you keep the extra-data short enough. I'd like to change this type definition to either be fixed-length 32 bytes, or have more capacity, but we'll stick to the current thing for interop stability)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> It is the least invasive way wrt eth1 today. But having the dynamic type in there is less clean wrt graffiti and ssz typing (makes execution header dynamic sized instead of fixed for near zero gain)

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> Least invasive was why I was fine with it during spec review as that is generally a guiding principle. Worth at least discussing though

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> I agree with that. Having the header of a static length is just good but the value of having it static isn‚Äôt clear to me. I would consider the comparison of difficulties with dynamic extra_data on consensus-layer vs making it static on the execution-layer to make the final descision on whether do we want to change this at the merge or in a clean up hardfork

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> I can imagine that dynamic field brings a bit of additional complexity in implementations and potentially bug prone (if one hadn‚Äôt considered that this field is dynamic is some part of the code)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> Its worth avoiding changes to fields in data structures that we know are coming ina future fork. As in, if we want fixed, I think it not worth the complexity and uncleanliness of doing dynamic today and fixed in +8 months
That said if dynamic of max 32 is fine, then let it be fine. I wouldnt alter core data structures in a cleanup fork just for that small of a change

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> Proto isnt up. I'll let him make his case tmw
Signing off over here üëã

author: bridge-bot
content:
<n0ble> > As in, if we want fixed, I think it not worth the complexity and uncleanliness of doing dynamic today and fixed in +8 months
makes sense to me!

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> Later!

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Lighthouse is now passing M1 üéâ I've updated the milestone tracker.
One thing I noticed is that Geth doesn't like having 0x00..00 for the finalized block hash in engine_forkchoiceUpdated. It returns "error":{"code":4,"message":"unknown header"}. According to EIP-3675 this is a valid value. I'll make a comment on the PR with some more details (cc @vdWijden)

author: bridge-bot
content: <n0ble> congrats on M1 üéâ

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Forwarded from sigpaul: For the Consensus Clients, are there any thoughts about what we use for the classic "eth1" connection (i.e., following the deposit contract).
We still have the --dummy-eth1 flag hanging around that we used for 2019 interop. That seems pretty appealing, at least for the initial testnets.
We're setup on our end to accept different endpoints for "eth1" and "execution engine". We can also run with a real execution engine and a dummy "eth1" node.
Interested to hear what might work for y'all.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Forwarded from sigpaul: Also, on a separate note, I notice the milstone tracker says
> run 1:1 devnet without transition (TTD == 0)
When I ran against Geth this wouldn't work because:
- If the EE is on the genesis block, there's no parent so get_pow_block_at_terminal_total_difficulty fails.
- Even if there was a parent block, it wouldn't trigger genesis because the TD in Geth was static so I could never find a parent with a TD less than TTD.
So, to overcome this, I set TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH to the genesis block in Geth.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> I've been successful with making a testnet where I start with Phase0, fork to Altair and then fork to Merge.
However, I'm having trouble just starting from the Merge fork. Since we're setting the state.execution_payload_head to non-zero values in initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1, we're giving the execution node a junk parent block. It doesn't like that.
I have to go and haven't thought this out fully, but I would be tempted to set the genesis state to default/all-zero so that the genesis slot has !is_merge_complete and then we can complete the merge on the first slot (or some later slot).

author: bridge-bot
content:
<hwwang> Right, initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1 mocks the complete transition state. If you want to test the merge transition, setting state.latest_execution_payload_header = spec.ExecutionPayloadHeader() is required. (re @sigpaul: I've been successful with making a testnet where I start with Phase0, fork to Altair and then fork to Merge.
However, I'm having trouble just starting from the Merge fork. Since we're setting the state.execution_payload_head to non-zero values in initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1, we're giving the execution node a junk parent block. It doesn't like that.
I have to go and haven't thought this out fully, but I would be tempted to set the genesis state to default/all-zero so that the genesis slot has !is_merge_complete and then we can complete the merge on the first slot (or some later slot).)

author: bridge-bot
content: <hwwang> Do we want two modes initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1? one for complete transition, one for incomplete transition? üòÖ

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> I see, so the intention is to supply an Eth1 block hash that is actually a valid hash? Previously we‚Äôve done it as a static value.
It‚Äôs definitely possible to use a valid hash, but we don‚Äôt really have the ‚Äúplumbing‚Äù in place to get a dynamic value there.
Is there immediately visible value in having a non-zero execution header for the genesis state? If not, I‚Äôd suggest just making one function which is all zero.
Alternatively, we can just ignore that function, start from Altair and fork at epoch 1.
The latter option is totally fine by me. (re @hwwang: Right, initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1 mocks the complete transition state. If you want to test the merge transition, setting state.latest_execution_payload_header = spec.ExecutionPayloadHeader() is required.)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Hey all,
I've updated Geth to spec v1.0.0.alpha.2 https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/23607#issuecomment-931897512
and fixed several issues that came up (thanks to <@!361447803194441738> , <@!543900561460822016> , <@!758579010027782144> :
- Properly setting BaseFeePerGas
- Properly setting ExtraData
- Renaming `forkChoiceUpdated` to `forkchoiceUpdated`
- Using an object for the `payloadId` response
- Ignoring empty finalizedBlockHash in `forkchoiceUpdated` calls (as per spec)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> . üéâ (re @amphora_interop_bot: <MariusVanDerWijden>Hey all,
I've updated Geth to spec v1.0.0.alpha.2 https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/23607#issuecomment-931897512
and fixed several issues that came up (thanks to <@361447803194441738> , @lightclient , <@758579010027782144> :
- Properly setting BaseFeePerGas
- Properly setting ExtraData
- Renaming `forkChoiceUpdated` to `forkchoiceUpdated`
- Using an object for the `payloadId` response
- Ignoring empty finalizedBlockHash in `forkchoiceUpdated` calls (as per spec))

author: bridge-bot
content:
<n0ble> Forking at epoch 1 having only genesis block in the execution chain doesn‚Äôt work as a terminal block must have a parent. You‚Äôd need to mine one block on top of genesis for this scenario. Probably, it would be easier to seed the genesis state with the hash of the genesis block (re @sigpaul: I see, so the intention is to supply an Eth1 block hash that is actually a valid hash? Previously we‚Äôve done it as a static value.
It‚Äôs definitely possible to use a valid hash, but we don‚Äôt really have the ‚Äúplumbing‚Äù in place to get a dynamic value there.
Is there immediately visible value in having a non-zero execution header for the genesis state? If not, I‚Äôd suggest just making one function which is all zero.
Alternatively, we can just ignore that function, start from Altair and fork at epoch 1.
The latter option is totally fine by me.)

content:
<nashatyrev_a> @vdWijden Another question: 
GENESIS_GAS_LIMIT = 30000000 in the spec (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/merge/beacon-chain.md#genesis-testing-settings)
Geth returns the block with gasLimit = 10000000(https://notes.ethereum.org/@9AeMAlpyQYaAAyuj47BzRw/rkwW3ceVY#Genesis)
Should it be fixed on your side?

When I ran against Geth this wouldn't work because:

- Even if there was a parent block, it wouldn't trigger genesis because the TD in Geth was static so I could never find a parent with a TD less than TTD.
So, to overcome this, I set TERMINAL_BLOCK_HASH to the genesis block in Geth.)
